abstract:
Let $(X_1 \cdots X_n)$ be multivariate normal, with mean vector
$\boldsymbol{\mu}$ and covariance matrix $\boldsymbol{\Sigma}$, and let
$S_n=\mathrm{e}^{X_1}+\cdots+\mathrm{e}^{X_n}$. The Laplace transform ${\cal
L}(\theta)=\mathbb{E}\mathrm{e}^{-\theta S_n}$ is represented as $\tilde {\cal
L}(\theta)I(\theta)$ where $\tilde {\cal L}(\theta)$ is obtained by integrating
the second order Taylor expansion around the minimizer $\boldsymbol{x}^*$ of
the exponent of the integrand in the defining integral and $I(\theta)$ is the
correction terms. An algorithm for calculating the asymptotic expansion of
$\boldsymbol{x}^*$ is presented, it is shown that $I(\theta)\to 1$ as
$\theta\to\infty$, and a variety of numerical methods for evaluating
$I(\theta)$ are discussed, including Monte Carlo with importance sampling and
quasi Monte Carlo. Numerical examples (including Laplace transform inversion
for the density of $S_n$) are also presented.
